section.heading: Jurisdiction to modify child support order of another state when individual parties reside in the District.

annoGroup.heading: History
annoGroup.annotation: as added July 24, 1998, D.C. Law 12-131, § 2(m), 45 DCR 2924

annoGroup.heading: Section References
annoGroup.annotation: This section is referenced in § 46-306.10 and § 46-306.11.

annoGroup.heading: Effect of Amendments
annoGroup.annotation: D.C. Law 13-91 deleted the phrase “of this chapter” following the enumeration of subchapters.

annoGroup.heading: Temporary Addition of Section
annoGroup.annotation: For temporary (225 day) addition of section, see § 2(m) of Uniform Interstate Family Support Temporary Amendment Act of 1998 (D.C. Law 12-94, April 29, 1998, law notification 45 DCR).

annoGroup.heading: Emergency Legislation
annoGroup.annotation: For temporary addition of section, see § 2(m) of the Uniform Interstate Family Support Emergency Amendment Act of 1997 (D.C. Act 12-225, December 23, 1997, 45 DCR 151).
For temporary addition of section, see § 2(m) of the Uniform Interstate Family Support Congressional Review Emergency Amendment Act of 1998 (D.C. Act 12-310, March 20, 1998, 45 DCR 1950).

annoGroup.heading: Editor's Notes
annoGroup.annotation: Uniform Law: This section is based upon § 613 of the Uniform Interstate Family Support Act (2001 Act).
